meanings.definition: To prepare a preliminary version of a document or plan.
meanings.sent1: She drafted a rough outline for her essay.
meanings.sent2: The students drafted their project proposal together.
meanings.sent3: He drafted a silly doodle on the corner of his notebook.
meanings.sent4: The artist drafted the first sketch of her masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: They drafted a detailed map to guide them on the hike.

meanings.definition: To select someone for compulsory military service.
meanings.sent1: The army drafted young men during the war.
meanings.sent2: He was drafted into the military last year.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cat would be drafted if pets were included.
meanings.sent4: The coach drafted the strongest players for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: They drafted new recruits to join the army unit.

meanings.definition: To pull or draw something along.
meanings.sent1: She drafted the heavy suitcase across the room.
meanings.sent2: The horse drafted the cart up the hill.
meanings.sent3: He playfully drafted his friend into a game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind drafted the leaves along the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: They drafted the boat safely to the shore.
